commentary_data: Squad: Devon Conway, Ruturaj Gaikwad, Ajinkya Rahane, Shivam Dube, Ravindra Jadeja, MS Dhoni(w/c), Dwaine Pretorius, Deepak Chahar, Mitchell Santner, Sisanda Magala, Tushar Deshpande, Ambati Rayudu, Akash Singh, Subhranshu Senapati, Shaik Rasheed, RS Hangargekar, Ben Stokes, Moeen Ali, Ajay Jadav Mandal, Prashant Solanki, Simarjeet Singh, Matheesha Pathirana, Maheesh Theekshana, Bhagath Varma, Nishant Sindhu

Squad: Yashasvi Jaiswal, Jos Buttler, Sanju Samson(w/c), Riyan Parag, Shimron Hetmyer, Dhruv Jurel, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jason Holder, Trent Boult, Sandeep Sharma, Yuzvendra Chahal, Murugan Ashwin, Navdeep Saini, Akash Vasisht, KM Asif, Donavon Ferreira, Joe Root, Adam Zampa, KC Cariappa, Obed McCoy, Devdutt Padikkal, Kuldip Yadav, Kuldeep Sen, Abdul Basith, Kunal Singh Rathore

CSK have returned to their fortress and they truly know how to rule the roost in their home conditions and it will certainly be a stern test for RR. MSD will be leading CSK for the 200th time in the IPL and it is a big occasion for him tonight. After losing their opening game, CSK have won two games in a row. RR also have two wins out of three games. With a chance to top the table on offer, expect a humdinger of a contest. If the Chepauk surface plays true to its nature, expect spin to play a substantial part. In the last game here, we saw more than 420 runs scored. Even Dhoni was surprised by the way the surface played but saying all that, the spinners did extract good purchase. These two teams have ticked most boxes so far. Will Dhoni lead CSK to a hat-trick of wins in today's historic game? Or will RR breach CSK's fortress? Stay with us as toss and team lineups will be out in a while..
from Chepauk pings: This will be . As a result, he is being felicitated by N.Srinivasan.

Lots of cracks, not a lot of grass. The surface is firm enough here but fully expect the spinners and cutters to play a major role in this type of surface. The way the openers approach the game in the powerplay can have an impact on the game. In the middle overs, the spinners will come into play. In the game against LSG, the spinners extracted good turn. It is going to turn and there will be a bit of bounce too. The key will be to bowl in the right lengths, on the 5-6 metres area,
Zampa was one of the first RR players to come out and have a bowl. No surprises if RR unleash three quality spinners tonight,

We will bowl first. It maybe slightly on the slower side, different from the first game. Dew may play a role and it might get better in the second innings. (On his 200th game as CSK captain in the IPL) It feels good and also I feel the crowd has been fantastic. Also the fact that we started in the old stadium, it was very hot and humid. But now it feels like we're playing in Switzerland. It's good to play. We have seen cricket change - how T20 was played at that point of time till now, a lot has changed. The crowd has been fantastic. We have had injury concerns and players were unavailable, but still we have done well.

We would have liked to bowl first too. We have started well but we need to continue the momentum. We are playing at Chepauk after a long time. We have experience and the youngsters to do that. It has always been a pleasure to come to Chepauk and play here.  and we have a couple of changes, you will come to know that. It's difficult to keep track with the sub rule.
(Playing XI): Devon Conway, Ruturaj Gaikwad, Ajinkya Rahane, Moeen Ali, Shivam Dube, Ravindra Jadeja, MS Dhoni(w/c), Sisanda Magala, Maheesh Theekshana, Tushar Deshpande, Akash Singh
(Playing XI): Yashasvi Jaiswal, Jos Buttler, Sanju Samson(w/c), Devdutt Padikkal, Shimron Hetmyer, Dhruv Jurel, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jason Holder, Kuldeep Sen, Sandeep Sharma, Yuzvendra Chahal
Ambati Rayudu, Mitchell Santner, Subhranshu Senapati, Shaik Rasheed, RS Hangargekar
Riyan Parag, Donavon Ferreira, KM Asif, Adam Zampa, Joe Root

I guess seeing what the surface is like at the time, last time we played here it was a new wicket, I haven't played here for quite a while, but there was a little bit more bounce than compared to some other Indian wickets. I found out this wicket has bounce (while playing for Australia), had a warm-up bowl now and it looks like it is doing the same thing. If we bowl second and it gets wet then it changes the game. Lot of planning goes into it, as a young man I was negligent but I have played a lot of cricket now and you have to bowl to guys' weaknesses, bit of planning and then backing my skill. It is all new to the game and we are trying to work it out ourselves, the new sub rules can change the game quickly, just being ready and grabbing the opportunity when it comes. I have played with Yuzi before as well, we sit back after the game and discuss what we could have done better, we have done that for the last couple of years and are happy to help each other.

(On what has worked for CSK) The important guys have performed really well, Rutu is in good form, Jadeja is in good form, Santner has bowled really well in the last three games. As a group, we are performing really well and the guys are putting up their hands. Ajinkya coming in his first game and putting in a man of the match performance, we can’t expect anything better from the team and hopefully we can continue tonight. (On his bowling plans) The boundaries are a bit bigger on the squarer side, so force the batters to hit on the square options. Change of pace always a good option. The previous wicket played really good so let’s see how the wicket plays tonight. (On playing under MSD) The calmness he brings to the team, then also the excitement of the crowd, every game feels like a home game. It is awesome to play under him and may he play for many more years to come.

A roaring atmosphere in Chennai as the umps and the players walk out. Out walk Buttler and Jaiswal too. Akash Singh ready to come in. He will have to wait as the timer ticks down. A wide slip in for Akash.

MSD's 200th game is such a roller coaster moment for us as a fan.
The match being in Chepauk is such a great gift to MSD and his fans.
Hope we see him bat more.
#Yellove
Akash Singh to Jaiswal, no run,  Jaiswal on the charge first ball, this is the inswinger and he got an inside-edge onto the pads on the flick, good call not to go for the review
Akash Singh to Jaiswal, no run, full outswinger outside off, Jaiswal goes for a big drive and misses, shaped away nicely

Akash Singh to Jaiswal, , so poor from Theekshana at third man. A back of a length delivery outside off, Jaiswal cuts and Theekshana gets across and slides to his left, the ball slips under the body, may have just overrun that too, the slide was unnecessary to be honest
Akash Singh to Jaiswal, , good length angling into middle and leg, Jaiswal flicks wide of mid-wicket and it races away. Good start
Akash Singh to Jaiswal, no run, back of a length outside off, Jaiswal punches hard and straight to cover
Akash Singh to Jaiswal, no run, good length outside off, Jaiswal punches nicely but picks out cover-point
Interestingly, Akash Singh made his RR debut vs CSK and now CSK debut vs RR. Excited to see how the fiery left arm quick fares!
Tushar Deshpande to Buttler, no run, back of a length outside off, shapes away, Buttler has a look and shoulders arms
Tushar Deshpande to Buttler, 1 run, full outswinger outside off, Buttler gets forward and drives to sweeper cover, is off the mark
Tushar Deshpande to Jaiswal, 2 runs, fullish outside off, Jaiswal goes up and over mid-off, clears Dube who tracks back and pulls it back
Tushar Deshpande to Jaiswal,  Caught!!

Tushar Deshpande to Jaiswal,  Caught by Shivam Dube!! The hard back of a length into the pitch gets Jaiswal. He was in no position to play the pull, rushed by it, he miscues it off the splice and it's an easy catch for Dube at mid-off.
Tushar Deshpande to Padikkal, no run, 142.2kph, full on the stumps, nice off-drive but straight to the fielder at mid-off
Tushar Deshpande to Padikkal, 1 run, good length and angling away from Padikkal who gets off the mark with a dab to third man
Theekshana to Padikkal, 1 run, flicker and full on the stumps, Padikkal gets forward to drive to long-off
Expect the flickers from Theekshana, seam-up and the occasional variation like the offbreaks. Will slide on and even swing in to the right-hander.
Theekshana to Buttler, 1 run, the good length flicker on middle and leg, tucked to the mid-wicket region for a quick single
CSK and MSD are known for giving opportunities to the youngsters in the side. Let's see how effective it will be for them this season.
A slip in

Theekshana to Padikkal, , Theekshana went round the wicket and bowled the offbreak full on the stumps, Padikkal gets forward and eases a lovely drive, all timing through extra-cover and no chance for long-off to his right

Theekshana to Padikkal, , good delivery and MS applauds too, but it has run away for four to third man. A slower offbreak outside off, Padikkal reaches for it pokes it, the thick outside-edge flies wide of Mo and beats the chase of Akash
Theekshana to Padikkal, no run, quicker slider on a back of a length on the stumps, Padikkal punches to mid-on
Theekshana to Padikkal, no run, another slider, quicker on the stumps, Padikkal goes on the back foot to defend to cover
A backward point, gully and short third man for Buttler against Akash
Akash Singh to Buttler, 1 run, pitched up outside off, Buttler gets forward and drives with an open face to deep point
Akash Singh to Padikkal, 2 runs, full and angling into middle-stump, Padikkal loses his bottom-hand as he lofts but clears mid-on
Akash Singh to Padikkal, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Padikkal stabs at it, the thick outside-edge runs through a vacant gully
It's been long since we saw a good innings from Padikkal, today he has a chance to show his calibre
Akash Singh to Buttler, 1 run, floaty slower ball off-cutter on the stumps, Buttler gets forward to drive wide of mid-off for one
Akash Singh to Padikkal, no run, slower ball again, off-cutter on the stumps, Padikkal comes down the track and drives to cover
Akash Singh to Padikkal, 1 run, a slower ball on a good length on middle, knocked to the mid-wicket area for an easy single

Theekshana to Padikkal, 1 run,  Went low and to the left of him and he could not react quickly. Was the flatter delivery on the stumps, Padikkal opens the face of the bat and dabs it, hits the left shin of Mo
Theekshana to Buttler, , tossed up offbreak outside off, in the slot, Buttler gets forward and knifes the loft over long-off
Theekshana to Buttler, 1 run, again the offbreak, on a good length on off and middle, turned through square leg
Theekshana to Padikkal, , superb shot. Opens the off-side field by making room and then uses his hands to stay low and drive it wide of cover-point and extra-cover
Great thinking from RR to send Devdutt on the fall of wicket. It maintains the L-R combination + he is an opener and the situation would be similar. This will bring the best out of him
Theekshana to Padikkal, 1 run, full on the stumps, Padikkal gets forward to drive wide of Jadeja at long-off

Theekshana to Buttler, , intentionally carved up and over the off-side field, flat back of a length delivery outside off, Buttler goes on the back foot and opens the face of the bat to get it over cover-point
Tushar Deshpande to Padikkal, , Padikkal is looking to be aggressive in the powerplay. Makes room outside the leg-stump and forehands the slower ball wide of Dube at mid-off, raced away
Tushar Deshpande to Padikkal, , poor delivery and put away. A slower ball down leg, Padikkal knows short fine is inside and flicks it wide of him. Easy boundary
Third man in now. Mid-wicket goes back
Tushar Deshpande to Padikkal, 1 run, back of a length on the middle and leg line, tucked to deep backward square leg
Theekshana was supposed to be the X-factor today. Surprised to see him hammered for runs.
Tushar Deshpande to Buttler, 1 run, Buttler shuffles across outside off and it's a back of a length delivery, clipped to fine-leg
Tushar Deshpande to Padikkal, 1 run, back of a length on the stumps, Padikkal runs it down to short third man where Magala dives to stop
Tushar Deshpande to Padikkal, 1 run, back of a length on the stumps, Padikkal runs it down to short third man where Magala dives to stop
Tushar Deshpande to Buttler, 1 run, slower ball off-cutter on off, Buttler gets forward to drive to long-on
Jadeja to Buttler, , such a poor start this. Fires it down leg, Buttler misses the pull and MS had no chance
Jadeja to Buttler, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Buttler punches to long-off
Jadeja to Padikkal, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Padikkal cuts hard and straight to the fielder at sweeper cover
Jadeja to Buttler, , another wide down leg as Jadeja goes quicker
Buttler's towel tucked into his back falls down. MS asks Jadeja to stop
Jadeja to Buttler, 1 run, fullish and drifting into middle-stump, Buttler gets forward to drive to long-on
Jadeja to Padikkal, no run, quicker and across Padikkal outside off, who cuts and misses, bit of extra bounce
Jadeja to Padikkal, 1 run, not one flighted ball this over, back of a length just outside off, Padikkal runs it down to short third man
Jadeja to Buttler, 1 run, good length into middle and leg, flicked through mid-wicket
Moeen Ali to Buttler, 1 run, good length and tossed up outside off, Buttler goes on the back foot to steer through point
Moeen Ali to Padikkal, 3 runs, Moeen Ali tosses it up nicely, lures Padikkal out of his crease, who outside-edges the loft and it goes wide of Magala at short third man, he chases and saves a run
Moeen Ali to Buttler, 1 run, slower offbreak outside off, fraction short too, Buttler cuts to deep point
Moeen Ali to Padikkal, 1 run, on the pads, on a length, Padikkal sweeps to deep backward square leg
Moeen Ali to Padikkal, 1 run, on the pads, on a length, Padikkal sweeps to deep backward square leg
Moeen Ali to Buttler, , dragged down and Buttler is so quick to rock back and pull over mid-wicket, short outside off and Buttler smashes the pull over deep mid-wicket
Moeen Ali to Buttler, , and again. Another short ball, Buttler sends the pull even further into the stands at deep mid-wicket, two gifts from his England mate and Buttler accepted it with glee
Jadeja to Padikkal, 2 runs, slower and across Padikkal who top-edges the sweep to the right of deep square leg, Dube almost overruns the ball but manages to keep it to two
Jadeja to Padikkal, no run, back of a length and sliding across Padikkal who cuts straight to the fielder at backward point
Jadeja to Padikkal,  Caught!!

Jadeja to Padikkal,  Caught by Conway!! Jadeja breaks the stand. Wider and across Padikkal, makes the left-hander fetch the slogsweep, a top-edge and Conway at deep backward square leg makes no mistake. CSK needed that wicket.
After the early loss of Jaiswal, this stand was looking dangerous for CSK till Jadeja broke it. But still Buttler is there and that's worrying signs for the home team.
Jadeja to Samson, no run, quicker back of a length delivery outside off, cut to backward point
Jadeja to Samson,  Bowled!!

Jadeja to Samson,  Bowled!! What a cracker. Samson falls for a duck again. Fullish and quicker, drifting into middle and leg, Samson made the mistake of going back and then it turns from there, past the back foot block, the off-stump is knocked back. Fine over produces two wickets for CSK.

Jadeja to Ashwin, no run,  Tough chance and Jadeja is holding his hands on his head. Is Mo standing too far forward? This flies off a thick outside-edge as Ashwin looks to defend, went at chest-height, a couple of grabs from Mo and down it goes
Magala to Buttler, 2 runs, back of a length outside off, Buttler nudges to the right of deep backward square leg for a couple of runs
Magala to Buttler, 1 run, fullish outside off, Buttler gets forward to drive to long-on, did not time it well
Magala to Ashwin, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, Ashwin opens the face of the bat to run it down to third man
Magala to Ashwin, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, Ashwin opens the face of the bat to run it down to third man
Magala to Buttler, 1 run, full and hint of shape back in on the stumps, Buttler drives to long-on
Magala to Ashwin, , short and down leg, Ashwin hooks and misses, wide called
Magala to Ashwin, no run, back of a length on off, Ashwin gets forward and pushes it to backward point

This is the third time Ashwin is batting at No.5 in the IPL. The last instance came against CSK at Brabourne last year - which was RR's last league game - and he produced 40*(23) in a successful 152-run chase that ensured RR's second finish in the points table.
Magala to Ashwin, 1 run, length delivery on off, Ashwin gets forward to drive to long-on
Jadeja to Ashwin, no run, quicker and at 100kph on the stumps, defended back
Jadeja to Ashwin, no run, length delivery on the stumps, pushed to cover
Don't understand why MS in not utilising Rahane at slip! He is a fine slip fielder.
Jadeja to Ashwin, 1 run, fullish on the stumps, Ashwin gets forward to drive to long-off
Jadeja to Buttler, no run, fullish just outside off, Buttler toe-ends the reverse-sweep and it does not go far
Jadeja to Buttler, 1 run, fullish on the pads, flicked through square leg
Jadeja to Ashwin, no run, 102.6kph, full on the pads, sliding down leg, Ashwin flicks and gets a hint of a thick leading-edge that does not carry to backward point

RR are thinking to have someone hold one end and allow others to attack from the other, hence Ashwin came out on no. 5. Hopefully this doesn't backfire. -- "Or he will have a better idea of the conditions as it is his home ground."
Magala to Buttler, no run, good length outside off, Buttler leans into a fine cover drive but straight to the fielder at cover
Magala to Buttler, 1 run, full outside off, Buttler gets forward and down the track to knock it to long-on
Magala to Ashwin, 2 runs, back of a length on the stumps, Ashwin flicks to the right of deep square leg and comes back for the second
Magala to Ashwin, 2 runs, short on the stumps, Ashwin miscues the pull but gets it to the left of deep square leg for another couple
Magala to Ashwin, 1 run, low full-toss on the stumps, Ashwin drives to long-on
Ashwin & Buttler batting together, Beauty of IPL
Magala to Buttler, 1 run, full on the pads, flicked to deep backward square leg
Jadeja to Buttler, 1 run, back of a length on the middle and leg line, tucked to deep square leg
Jadeja to Buttler, 1 run, back of a length on the middle and leg line, tucked to deep square leg
Jadeja to Ashwin, , fired down leg, Ashwin flicks and misses, MS prevents more runs
No.

Jadeja to Ashwin, no run, that unplayable drift in turn away delivery that Jadeja bowls so well, Ashwin looks to flick across the line and misses, sharp turn for Jadeja and MS has the bails off in a flash, Ashwin though did not lift his back foot
Jadeja to Ashwin, 1 run, length delivery on the pads, flicked through mid-wicket
Jadeja to Buttler, 1 run, back of a length on off, Buttler goes on the back foot to tap it down in front of cover
Jadeja to Ashwin, 1 run, quicker length delivery on the pads, Ashwin turns the strike over with a flick through mid-wicket
Jadeja to Buttler, 1 run, fullish outside off, steered to backward point for one

CSK have come back so well after the first timeout. Jadeja with wickets and doing a stellar job in his four overs. Ashwin has not played a shot in anger after being dropped first ball. All this while Buttler from the other end, is starved of the strike.
Theekshana to Buttler, 1 run, good length and no spin on the stumps, tucked to deep mid-wicket

Theekshana to Ashwin, no run,  Ashwin comes down the track and miscues the drive to cover, is halfway down the track, Mo goes to his left and fumbles, then his throw is well wide of MS who can't get there even with a dive. Ashwin was well out too
Theekshana to Ashwin, , Ashwin makes room outside the leg-stump and this is fired in full on the stumps, sliced between backward point and short third man
Theekshana to Ashwin, 1 run, back of a length on the stumps, Ashwin makes room and cuts to short third man, the fielder dives to his right to keep it to one

Don't think any other keeper still even comes close to the kind of reflexes MSD has behind the stumps. Hitting sixes to one of fastest bowlers going around Mark Wood, taking the bails off in a flash. Is he even getting old? Truly a legend of the game like no one else, hope to see him keep playing.
Theekshana to Buttler, 1 run, short of length outside off, Buttler goes on the back foot to tap it square of the wicket on the off-side
Theekshana to Ashwin, 2 runs, Ashwin comes down the track and drives the full ball wide of long-off for an easy couple
Akash Singh to Buttler, 1 run, a slower ball on a good length outside off, Buttler punches to sweeper cover
Akash Singh to Ashwin, , Ashwin releases the pressure, dug in short but it's the slower ball, Ashwin carves the pull annd just clears deep mid-wicket
Akash Singh to Ashwin, , into the crowd again. This is a good length delivery on the stumps, Ashwin heaves it and gets enough to clear deep mid-wicket. Stayed back and swung
Akash Singh to Ashwin, , into the crowd again. This is a good length delivery on the stumps, Ashwin heaves it and gets enough to clear deep mid-wicket. Stayed back and swung
Square  leg in now
Akash Singh to Ashwin, 1 run, full and wide outside off, Ashwin opens the face of the bat to carve to deep point
Akash Singh to Buttler, 1 run, full and wide outside off, Buttler gets across and reaches for it to carve to deep point
Akash Singh to Ashwin, , this time the wide yorker is too wide on the off-side
looks like Mo is  having a tough time on the field today otherwise he is a sharp fielder
Akash Singh to Ashwin,  Caught!!

Akash Singh to Ashwin,  Caught by Magala!! Ashwin holes out. Full and wide outside off, sliced in the air and Magala at extra-cover takes it. Immediately looks at his fingers and calls for the physio. Hopefully he has not done something serious.
Theekshana to Buttler, 2 runs,  Good length on middle, flicked to deep mid-wicket and placed well for a couple
Theekshana to Buttler, 1 run, length delivery on the pads, glanced to short fine
Theekshana to Hetmyer, 1 run, quicker and straighter on middle, tucked through square leg as Hetmyer gets off the mark
Theekshana to Buttler, 1 run, full and almost yorker length on the pads, flicked to deep backward square leg
Theekshana round the wicket
Theekshana to Hetmyer, no run, full outside off, Hetmyer gets forward to defend it back
I really like the new design of this stadium, keeps it so ventilated. A must in coastal cities during summers.
Again Mo is at slip
Theekshana to Hetmyer, 1 run, length delivery outside off, knocked through the mid-wicket area
Moeen Ali to Hetmyer, 1 run, drifting into the pads, glanced to short fine-leg for a quick single
Moeen Ali to Buttler,  Bowled!!
Moeen Ali to Buttler,  Bowled!!

Moeen Ali to Buttler,  Bowled!! Mo gets Buttler. No celebrations or anything from Mo. He has got the big wicket. Nicely tossed up offbreak outside off, Buttler goes for a big slogsweep and misses, the ball turns back in to hit off-stump.
Moeen Ali to Dhruv Jurel, no run, good length offbreak outside off, Dhruv Jurel turns to short mid-wicket and there's no quick single there
Moeen Ali to Dhruv Jurel, 1 run, quicker and turning in to off, Dhruv Jurel whips to deep mid-wicket
Moeen Ali to Hetmyer, no run, fullish on off and hint of turn away, Hetmyer gets forward to defend to backward point
A slip in now for Hetmyer
Moeen Ali to Hetmyer, 1 run, quicker and on a length on the stumps, Hetmyer tucks to deep mid-wicket
Tushar Deshpande to Hetmyer, no run, full and wide outside off, Hetmyer reaches for it and mistimes the drive, gets it back to Tushar Deshpande
Tushar Deshpande to Hetmyer, 1 run, went for the yorker but it's a high full-toss, mishit to long-off
Tushar Deshpande to Dhruv Jurel, 1 run, slower ball on a back of a length on off, Dhruv Jurel pulls to deep square leg
Tushar Deshpande to Hetmyer, no run, Hetmyer shuffles across a little and lets the slower ball wide outside off go, the ump thinks it's not a wide
IPL is truly alive with nail-biting finishes for last three days... may be we will see same with today's match... MSD loading 20th over..
Tushar Deshpande to Hetmyer, , Hetmyer has the hits. A low full-toss outside off, he gets across and biffs it over long-on, cleared the fielder on the fence
Tushar Deshpande to Hetmyer, , now this is wide of the tramline on the off-side
Tushar Deshpande to Hetmyer, , the thick outside-edge helps. A slower ball across Hetmyer who swings to leg and the outside-edge clears short third man
Akash Singh to Dhruv Jurel, 1 run, wide low full-toss outside off, slammed to sweeper cover for one
Akash Singh to Hetmyer, 1 run, full outside off, Hetmyer drags the heave to deep mid-wicket
Akash Singh to Hetmyer, 1 run, full outside off, Hetmyer drags the heave to deep mid-wicket
Akash Singh to Dhruv Jurel, 1 run, full and wide outside off, Dhruv Jurel lofts to long-off without any timing
Akash Singh to Hetmyer, , Akash Singh misses the yorker, a high full-toss outside off, Hetmyer stays back and flat-bats the loft over the leaping long-on
Akash Singh to Hetmyer, 1 run, full outside off, Hetmyer lofts to wide long-on, more off the inner half of the bat
Caught at long-off and will RR review this?  Is below the waist. So gone.
Akash Singh to Dhruv Jurel,  Caught!!

Akash Singh to Dhruv Jurel,  Caught by Shivam Dube!! The wide full-toss outside off works. Dhruv Jurel shuffles across and miscues it to long-off. They check for the height but it's below the waist so RR lose the review for they were the ones reviewing it.
Tushar Deshpande to Hetmyer, , half-volley outside off, Hetmyer stays deep and back, smashes it over Tushar Deshpande and straight down the ground
Tushar Deshpande to Hetmyer, 2 runs, slower ball on a length outside off, Hetmyer swings it to long-on and as soon as Hetmyer hit that, he called for two, make it easily

Tushar Deshpande to Hetmyer, no run, again . This time for a wide outside off. Don't think they will get this either. Poor review as it's well inside the line on the off-side, a slower ball off-cutter outside off, Hetmyer slogs and misses
Since game 1 to now, Deshpande has come a long way... Keep it up
Tushar Deshpande to Hetmyer, 1 run, slower ball off-cutter outside off again, Hetmyer finds extra-cover with a drive
Tushar Deshpande to Holder,  Caught!!

Tushar Deshpande to Holder,  Caught by Conway!! Holder goes. A slower ball off-cutter outside off, Holder swings and miscues the heave, straight to the fielder at deep mid-wicket. Conway hangs on reverse-cup.
. He is the  for Rajasthan Royals and Buttler has been subbed out.
Tushar Deshpande to Zampa,  Run Out!!

Tushar Deshpande to Zampa,  Zampa Run Out!! 1 run completed. . Zampa shuffles across and scoops the slower ball to Theekshana at short fine-leg, a sitter is dropped but the batters try to steal a second, the throw to Dhoni is enough who flicks it on to the stumps catching Zampa well short.

RR will be a tad disappointed for just making 175. They had the platform when Padikkal and Buttler were going well but then the game turned in one Jadeja over. Padikkal and Samson went and Ashwin was dropped first ball in that over. From there, Buttler and Ashwin struggled to force the pace till the latter hit two sixes off Akash Singh to break the shackles. Buttler though totally lost momentum and got out after his fifty. At the end a cameo from Hetmyer helped RR get to 175 when even that was looking doubtful. Again the spinners pulling things back for CSK and credit to MS for trusting Moeen Ali who had a shocker on the field with two drops and a run-out missed, Mo repaid that faith with the big wicket of Buttler. The pitch has help for the spinners and RR have three world-class ones in their team with Zampa as the Impact sub. Back for the chase shortly...

It started off as a really good wicket in the powerplay but it slowed down. Jadeja then bowled really well. It’s a decent score we have got but it will come down to the dew and how the wicket plays in the second half. In the powerplay, you are always trying to take advantage. But because we lost a few wickets, I had to extend a partnership and take it deeper. It is disappointing to get out in the death. But we got a good score. (On Jadeja) He bowls fast and gets it to turn. It's hard to see the variations - one spinning and one skidding. But we have Ashwin, Chahal and Zampa. We had a really good success with our spinners and traditionally it is a pretty good venue for spin.

Welcome back.. Boult is a big miss for Rajasthan Royals. He had picked up four wickets in the first over in the three games. But Zampa is a very good replacement. Sandeep will open the bowling in Boult's absence. We're ready to go..

Sandeep Sharma to Gaikwad, no run, appeal for LBW. Umpire Virender Sharma is not interested. Gaikwad walks down to counter the movement, the ball swings in and he ekes out an inside edge onto the pad, rolls to mid-wicket
Sandeep Sharma to Gaikwad, no run, slightly short in length, Gaikwad stands tall and punches it to cover
Samson asked Sandeep after the first ball whether he should come up to the stumps and ensure Gaikwad does not step out. The answer was no
Sandeep Sharma to Gaikwad, no run, back of a length and straigtening, Gaikwad waits and defends it late
Sandeep delivers but Gaikwad moved away at the last second. He had to fend it away with his hands and the pair have a chuckle. There was some disturbance behind the bowler
Sandeep delivers but Gaikwad moved away at the last second. He had to fend it away with his hands and the pair have a chuckle. There was some disturbance behind the bowler

Sandeep Sharma to Gaikwad, 2 runs, in the air and safe. Gaikwad wanted to loft through the line but this is not an easy surface to do that, mistimes it over mid-off and gets enough distance to beat a backtracking Chahal
Sandeep Sharma to Gaikwad, , fraction short and angling in, Gaikwad holds a nice shape and pulls it backward of square leg
Sandeep Sharma to Gaikwad, 1 run, swinging in and Gaikwad clips it down to long-on, retains strike
Kuldeep Sen to Gaikwad, 1 run, I0$ short of length delivery, Gaikwad arches back and cuts it to deep backward point
Based on the way the pitch behaved in 1st innings, RR will have things in their favor with 3 world class spinners in Ashwin, Chahal and Zampa
Slip in place. Third man in and point on the fence
Kuldeep Sen to Conway, 1 run, back of a length around off, Conway drops it with soft hands to point and opens his account
Kuldeep Sen to Gaikwad, leg byes, 1 run, leg-lined delivery and Gaikwad misses out, the ball deflects off the thigh pad
Kuldeep Sen to Conway, no run, back of a length close to off, Conway tries the tap and run to point, but the fielder was brought in to save the single
Kuldeep Sen to Conway, no run, I0$ delivery and Conway shimmies down, opens the bat face and crunches it straight to cover-point
Kuldeep Sen to Conway, no run, full pitcher around off, Conway drives crisply but straight to mid-off
Samson is up to the stumps now
Sandeep Sharma to Gaikwad, no run, good length ball and Gaikwad drives on the rise, beats extra cover but not mid-off
Sandeep Sharma to Gaikwad,  Caught!!

Sandeep Sharma to Gaikwad,  Caught by Jaiswal!! No Boult, no problem. Sandeep provides the early breakthrough and it is the big wicket of the in-form Gaikwad. Angled in and Gaikwad wanted to whip it through the leg-side, but all he manages is a leading edge and the ball goes high, Jaiswal calls for it and hangs on to a good catch.

Sandeep Sharma to Rahane, 3 runs, short and outside off, Rahane cuts to backward point and the fielder fumbles, he got something on the ball and that ensured it slowed down before reaching the fence, off the mark with three
Sandeep Sharma to Conway, 1 run, full delivery on leg-stump, Conway clips it to deep square leg
CSK need to maximize the powerplay before the spin attack starts.
FYI, Samson is not standing up to the stumps anymore
FYI, Samson is not standing up to the stumps anymore
Sandeep Sharma to Rahane, 1 run, on a length and close to off, Rahane pats it in front of backward point and quickly crosses over
Round the wicket to Conway
Sandeep Sharma to Conway, 1 run, slower ball angled in, Conway knocks it to mid-on and retains strike
Holder to Conway, no run, back of a length delivery around off, Conway goes for the pull and is beaten on the under-edge. The ball was angled in and there was no space for Conway to get the pull away
Holder is bowling round the wicket
Holder to Conway, no run, short of length on off, Conway stays back and defends down the pitch
Holder to Conway, 1 run, I0$ good length ball close to off, Conway works it to mid-wicket

Holder to Rahane, , fraction short and Rahane is quick to latch on, he pulls off the front foot and though he got it high on the bat, the ball cleared mid-wicket comfortably and raced away to the fence
Weird seeing Rahane bat against RR!!!!! Looks just yesterday when he donned the colour BLUE!
Holder to Rahane, 1 run, on a length and around off, Rahane nurdles it to deep square leg
Holder to Conway, , poor delivery and easily put away. Slanted down leg, Conway swivels and helps it along the way to long leg
Zampa to Rahane, no run, quicker and drifting in, Rahane is rushed into bringing his bat down and he knocks it back
Zampa to Rahane, no run, marginally short and Rahane carves the cut straight to backward point
Zampa to Rahane, 1 run, comes down the track and yorks himself, digs it out to mid-wicket
Zampa to Conway, , RR gifting some easy runs for Conway. This was very much like Holder's last ball - straying down leg, Conway sits down and sweeps it to fine leg. Not off the middle but who cares
Zampa to Conway, no run, flatter and around off, Conway prods forward and defends it back

Zampa to Conway, ,  Tough chance but Sandeep got both hands. Conway goes for the sweep and hits it hard, Sandeep times his jump correctly but was not able to deal with the pace on the ball and allows it to burst through his fingers
Ashwin to Rahane, 2 runs, tossed up outside off, Rahane lofts it over the off-side field with the bottom hand coming off, the ball plugs and it is only a brace

Ashwin is going to be the key for CSK, having played at Chepauk for years....
he understands the wicket better than anyone else, i believe.

Ashwin aborts from delivering the ball. He was not looking for a run-out at the bowler's end as Conway was not backing up. Just wanted to see what Rahane was doing and he was shimmying down the wicket
Now Rahane moves away and that gets the crowd going. Ashwin is the local boy but the support is for Rahane
Ashwin to Rahane, no run, carrom ball on off, Rahane closes the bat face and the leading edge rolls back to Ashwin

Ashwin to Rahane, ,  This has to be the shot of the match. Rahane shimmies down, gives himself room and lofts inside out. Not much flight and was pushed through but Rahane got under it and smoked it all the way
Ashwin to Rahane, 1 run, shortens the length and Rahane knocks it to long-on
Ashwin to Conway, no run, drifting in from round the wicket, Conway stays back and defends to cover
Ashwin to Conway, 1 run, flighted and drifting in, Conway nudges it to the vacant mid-wicket region
Chahal to Conway, no run, flighted delivery on off, Conway leans forward and defends it back
Chahal to Conway, no run, Chahal appeals for LBW. But it came off the glove. Conway goes for the reverse sweep and gloves it back down the pitch
Chahal to Conway, 1 run, tossed up close to off, Conway eases it to long-on
Chahal to Rahane, 1 run, floated up and dips on Rahane, he drives uppishly off the inner half and the ball goes to the right of Chahal
Chahal to Conway, , half tracker and Conway does not miss out, he rocks back quickly and belts the pull to deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Conway, 1 run, throws it up around off, Conway plays a whippy drive to long-on
Seen Rahane this good in his prime years ago, this feels nostalgic.
Holder to Conway, , RR have been generous to Conway today. Gifted him quite a few boundary balls. Full toss angled down leg, Conway whips it backward of square leg and the ball speeds away
Holder to Conway, 1 run, back of a length and cramping him up, Conway tucks it in front of square on the leg-side
Holder to Conway, 1 run, back of a length and cramping him up, Conway tucks it in front of square on the leg-side
Holder to Rahane, 1 run, I0$ short of length delivery and Rahane mistimes the pull to deep square leg. The ball did not come on
Holder to Conway, 1 run, on a length and outside off, Conway dabs it past backward point and down to third man
Holder to Rahane, 1 run, full delivery on leg-stump, Rahane flicks straight to deep backward square
Holder to Conway, 1 run, slower ball around off, Conway nudges it into the open mid-wicket region

This match is right in the balance. Some of the RR players are carrying towels but none have used them which is a good sign and means dew has not come into effect. They will hope for the conditions to remain the same as they still have 9 overs of spin up their sleeve. The asking rate is 9.5 and that should not worry CSK as of now.
Zampa to Conway, 2 runs, googly on leg-stump, Conway tucks it to square leg and immediately calls for two, easily done
Zampa to Conway, 1 run, tosses it up and drifts it across, Conway whips it past Zampa and down to long-on

Zampa to Rahane, 2 runs, just short of deep mid-wicket. Rahane comes down the track and does not get to the pitch, he goes through with the loft and miscues it towards cow corner, Jurel gets around and collects it on the bounce
Zampa to Rahane, 2 runs,  Tad short and Rahane pulls it wide of long-on, Holder moves to his right and makes a smart stop, he sends it in a flat throw and could have had Conway
Zampa to Rahane, , lovely shot! This is Rahane at his best. He shimmies down, gets close to the pitch of the ball and drills the drive inside out through extra cover. The placement was spot on
Heart says RR but want CSK to win this match for pure class of Rahane

Zampa to Rahane, , stifled appeal for LBW. Drifting down and Rahane misses the sweep, the ball brushes the pad on the way to short fine. In fact,  and UltraEdge shows no spike as it passes Rahane. Zampa is having a word with the umpire but will have to bowl the extra delivery
Zampa to Conway, 2 runs, googly and it is fraction short, Conway pulls it straight and Padikkal makes a sliding stop near long-on, saved two
Ashwin to Rahane, 1 run, quicker and at the pads, Rahane clips it backward of square leg
Ashwin to Conway, 1 run, sliding in from round the wicket, Conway cuts square of the wicket and picks up a single
Ashwin to Rahane,  Lbw!!

Ashwin to Rahane,  Lbw!! Ashwin breaks the partnership. Rahane and Conway have a discussion regarding the review, but looks like the former himself didn't want to send it upstairs. Carrom ball and Rahane premeditated the sweep, the length was too full and he ended up playing all over it, struck low on the pad and right in front of the stumps. That would have crashed into leg-stump and umpire Vinod Seshan made the right call.
Hoping for another last over thriller today!
Ashwin to Shivam Dube, 1 run, flatter and around off, Dube punches it to long-off
Ashwin to Conway, 1 run, quicker and outside off, Conway reverse sweeps and Zampa cuts it off near short third
Ashwin to Shivam Dube, no run, no flight and pushed through, Dube mistimes the punch to cover
Live pictures of the grass do reveal that there's a bit of dew on the ground. Ashwin was also seen wiping the ball while bowling his over. Let's see how the bowlers manage
Kuldeep Sen to Conway, 1 run, back of a length ball outside off, cut away to sweeper cover to keep things moving

Kuldeep Sen to Shivam Dube, 1 run, good work from Zampa! An off-pace back of a length ball outside off, dabbed away to the right of backward point and Zampa dives to restrict the batters from taking a couple
Kuldeep Sen to Conway, 1 run, Kuldeep Sen continues to bowl the hard length around off, Conway cuts it to the right of Zampa and he makes a half-stop. A run taken
Ashwin has now dismissed Rahane five times in the IPL, thrice at Chepauk. Only Bhuvneshwar Kumar has dismissed Rahane more often in the IPL (six times).
Kuldeep Sen to Shivam Dube, 1 run, 134.6kph back of a length ball in the tight off-stump zone, Shivam Dube stays leg side of the ball and places it towards cover point
Kuldeep Sen to Conway, 1 run, this is good bowling from Kuldeep Sen, keeping it tight. A slower one at 119kph on leg, turned to square leg for a single
Kuldeep Sen to Shivam Dube, 1 run, another hard length ball, on leg, no room to play with as Shivam Dube can only tuck it through backward square leg. Only 6 off the over
Ashwin to Shivam Dube, no run, skidding after landing on a length outside off, Dube mistimes his punch back to Ashwin
There's a stumping check against Dube. Seemed like he was fine. Yes, he is safe

Ashwin to Shivam Dube, no run, Shivam Dube looks to cut the flatter one bur misses and Samson takes the bails off. It is sent upstairs. For a moment, his back foot seemed to be on the crease but he got it back in time
Ashwin to Shivam Dube, , slips this one down the leg side, it has been wided
Ashwin to Shivam Dube, , crunched! A bit short outside off, Shivam Dube flat-bats it through mid-off. No chance for long-off to cut it off. That was hit hard
Ashwin to Shivam Dube, , this one turns away nicely from a fuller length outside off, Shivam Dube plays at it but misses. Wide called
Ashwin to Shivam Dube,  Lbw!!
Ashwin to Shivam Dube,  Lbw!!

Ashwin to Shivam Dube,  Lbw!!  Smart bowling from him. This one pitches on a length and skids through. Shivam Dube is caught in the crease as he tries to counter it but misses and is hit on the front pad. An appeal follows and the umpire rules it out. . That certainly didn't look that way in real time.
Ashwin to Moeen Ali, no run, flatter one on middle, eased to covers
Ashwin to Moeen Ali, 1 run, fired in on middle and leg, knocked down to long-on for a run
Chahal to Moeen Ali, no run, a bit short outside off, cut straight to covers where the fielder dives to stop it
Chahal to Moeen Ali, 2 runs, slower through the air on leg, played with soft hands in front of square on the on-side. It's in the gap and the batters get a couple

Chahal to Moeen Ali, no run, oh, that stayed low! Also, seemed there was an edge.  Quicker and flatter outside off, Moeen Ali looks to cut and gets an under-edge but Samson can't hold on to it. Moeen also lost control of his bat, it flew off his hand and fell near short leg
Chahal to Moeen Ali, 1 run, flatter on middle, tucked towards mid-wicket as Chahal chases it
- Yes there was definitely an edge as confirmed by UltraEdge
Chahal to Conway, 2 runs, loopy ball outside off, swept to deep mid-wicket. The fielder misfields and that allows a second run as the fielder from deep square leg tidies up
Chahal to Conway, no run, short ball but it turns away and goes past the flashy blade of Conway.
Zampa to Moeen Ali, no run, skiddy ball outside off, pushed away to covers
Zampa to Moeen Ali, 2 runs, a bit short outside off, cut away over backward point. The fielder in the deep runs to his right and keeps the batters down to a couple
Zampa to Moeen Ali, 1 run, flatter one outside off, cut away to backward point for a quick single
Zampa to Conway, 1 run, Conway goes for the slog sweep and drags it towards short fine leg
Zampa to Moeen Ali,  Caught!!
Zampa to Moeen Ali,  Caught!!

Zampa to Moeen Ali,  Caught by Sandeep Sharma!! CSK are losing their way! Zampa gets his first wicket! The trial by spin is certainly taking a toll on CSK. Googly around leg, Moeen Ali goes for the slog sweep but doesn't get it off the middle of the bat. The ball skies towards deep backward square leg. Sandeep moves to his left, gets low, and manages to hold onto it.
Zampa to Rayudu, 1 run, quicker one outside off, Rayudu goes for a drive but gets an inside edge that goes past the stumps and the keeper towards short fine
Chahal to Rayudu,  Caught!!

Chahal to Rayudu,  Caught by Hetmyer!! Another one bites the dust! The Impact player fails to make an impact. The flipper from Chahal and it's on a length on middle. Skids a bit and hurries Rayudu a bit. He miscues his pull shot towards deep mid-wicket. Hetmyer moves to his right, gets low, and dives to take a fine catch.
Chahal to Jadeja, 1 run, full-toss on the pads, clipped to deep mid-wicket for a run
Chahal to Conway, ,  Full ball on off, Conway clears his front leg and heaves it away through wide mid-on. No chance for long-on to cut it off
Chahal to Conway, , the length ball is too wide as Conway can't reach it, wided

Chahal to Conway, 3 runs, full on leg, slog swept past the right of short fine leg. The fielder from the deep moves to his left and dives to stop a run for his side.  Has been a decent knock but he needs support
Chahal to Jadeja, 1 run, length delivery down leg, tucked away to deep square leg for a run
Chahal to Conway,  Caught!!

Chahal to Conway,  Caught by Jaiswal!! Conway departs just after his Fifty! The asking rate has gone up over 12 and CSK are crumbling! Chahal pushes this one wider outside off, Conway has to reach out to it as he goes for a loft but gets it off the toe-end over extra cover. Jaiswal moves back, keeps his eyes on the ball, takes the catch, and then tumbles over.
Ashwin to Jadeja, 1 run, length ball on off, tucked away to long-on for a single
Ashwin to Jadeja, 1 run, length ball on off, tucked away to long-on for a single
Ashwin to Dhoni, 1 run, Dhoni is off the mark and it is met with a loud cheer from the crowd! Length ball on middle and leg, knocked down to long-on
Ashwin to Jadeja, 1 run, flatter on middle, knocked down to long-on again
Ashwin to Dhoni, no run, on a length outside off, punched away to point
Ashwin to Dhoni, 1 run, drifting in on a length, turned away to deep square leg
Ashwin to Jadeja, no run, flatter one at 97kph, bunted back to Ashwin

Looks unlikely at the stage, but you never write Dhoni off! Till he is at the crease, anything is possible. RR on top at the moment. Two overs of spin left as well and the ball has certainly gripped. CSK need a MSD special
Chahal to Dhoni, 1 run, on a length on off, skidding after landing, cut away to sweeper cover for a single
Chahal to Jadeja, 1 run, full ball on leg, Jadeja mistimes his chip shot over wide mid-on for a single. Singles are not gonna do for CSK, boundaries are needed
Chahal to Dhoni, 1 run, on a length on middle and leg and it's quicker in pace, Dhoni can only punch it down to long-on. Good bowling from Chahal
Chahal to Jadeja, 1 run, on a length outside off, Jadeja goes for a slog sweep but gets an edge and it flies past Samson towards short third man
Chahal to Dhoni, no run, quick and flat, Dhoni cuts it off his stumps and can only find point. Dot ball!
Chahal to Dhoni, 1 run, Chahal once again bowls it flat on off, punched away to wide long-off for only a single. Brilliant spell from Chahal.
Zampa to Dhoni, , poor ball and duly punished! Good start to the over. Down the leg side, Dhoni sweeps it away in the gap through backward square leg and the ball races to the fence
Zampa to Dhoni, 1 run, a short ball, the googly, and it keeps a bit low, pulled away straight to deep square leg for a run
Zampa to Jadeja, 1 run, a bit short and quick around off, pulled away straight to deep mid-wicket
Zampa to Dhoni, ,  Tossed up ball outside off, it's in the arc, Dhoni kneels down and with a free swing of the bat slog sweeps it over deep mid-wicket for a 84m six
Zampa to Dhoni, 1 run, flatter and quicker this time, Dhoni camps back and knocks it down to long-on for a single
Zampa to Dhoni, 1 run, flatter and quicker this time, Dhoni camps back and knocks it down to long-on for a single
Zampa to Jadeja, 1 run, quicker one on leg, worked away through in front of square on the on-side for just a single
They need to make this over count, at least target 20 off it. Holder to bowl the penultimate over. Dhoni has a chat with Jadeja
Holder to Jadeja, leg byes, 1 run, length ball angling into Jadeja from round the wicket, he tries to tuck it but the ball deflects off his thigh pad towards point. The batters steal a leg bye
Holder to Dhoni, 1 run, excellent from Holder! Yorker length ball around off, Dhoni can't get underneath it as he whips it to long-on for only a single
Holder to Jadeja, , full ball angling into Jadeja. He doesn't miss out and smashes it past Dhoni. No chance for long-on to cut it off.
Holder to Jadeja, , poor ball from Holder, it's on a length and down leg, Jadeja swings at it but misses as Samson collects it. Wided
Holder to Jadeja,  A length ball on leg, right in the arc for Jadeja and he tonks it over fine leg for a maximum. Poor ball as there was no protection in the deep there

Holder to Jadeja, no run, brilliant comeback! Full and angling in sharply towards Jadeja. He has no space to work with and can't connect as he his hit on the pads. Looks for a run but Holder charges in to deny the single
Holder to Jadeja, , in the arc, out of the park! Slot ball outside off, Jadeja smashes it down the ground and the ball clears the fence. 19 off the over
Sandeep Sharma to Dhoni, , the nerves are telling! Goes for a short one but digs it way outside off and it's beyond the tramline
Sandeep Sharma to Dhoni, , another one! Sandeep Sharma slips this one down the leg side, Dhoni looks to flick it away but misses. Wided again. Pressure getting the better of Sandeep Sharma
Sandeep Sharma to Dhoni, no run, excellent from Sandeep Sharma! Right in the blockhole on off, Dhoni can do nothing with it as he jams it back to Sandeep Sharma. 19 needed off 5 balls
Sandeep Sharma to Dhoni, ,  Game on! Full toss on the pads, Dhoni whips it away, Generated a lot of power and the ball went over the fence for a flat six
Samson has a chat with Sandeep again. Dhoni has done it a lot of times in the past, can he do it again?
Sandeep Sharma to Dhoni, , this is Dhoni at his best! The Chepauk crowd has gone berserk. Low full toss on off, Dhoni tonks it over deep mid-wicket for another six. Generated so much power on that
Sandeep Sharma to Dhoni, , this is Dhoni at his best! The Chepauk crowd has gone berserk. Low full toss on off, Dhoni tonks it over deep mid-wicket for another six. Generated so much power on that
Sandeep Sharma to Dhoni, , this is Dhoni at his best! The Chepauk crowd has gone berserk. Low full toss on off, Dhoni tonks it over deep mid-wicket for another six. Generated so much power on that
Dhoni looks cool as a cucumber as always. Are we going to see something special on the historic day for Dhoni? Sandeep switches to round the wicket
Dhoni looks cool as a cucumber as always. Are we going to see something special on the historic day for Dhoni? Sandeep switches to round the wicket
Sandeep Sharma to Dhoni, 1 run, on a length, not much space to play with as Dhoni hits it away towards deep mid-wicket for only a single
Sandeep Sharma to Dhoni, 1 run, on a length, not much space to play with as Dhoni hits it away towards deep mid-wicket for only a single
Dhoni has a chat with Jadeja. Can the latter follow on the footsteps of his skipper?
Dhoni has a chat with Jadeja. Can the latter follow on the footsteps of his skipper?
Sandeep Sharma to Jadeja, 1 run, brilliant yorker length ball outside off, Jadeja can only dig it out towards covers for a single
Sandeep Sharma to Jadeja, 1 run, brilliant yorker length ball outside off, Jadeja can only dig it out towards covers for a single
He has done it a lot of times for India and in the IPL as well. Will he pull off another memory to be cherished for a lifetime? Tension in the crowd but Dhoni looks unfazed
He has done it a lot of times for India and in the IPL as well. Will he pull off another memory to be cherished for a lifetime? Tension in the crowd but Dhoni looks unfazed

Sandeep Sharma to Dhoni, 1 run, brilliant from Sandeep Sharma! Not a memorable finish for Dhoni but he tried his best! A yorker outside off, Dhoni can't get underneath it as he whips it straight to deep mid-wicket. Sandeep Sharma has a beaming smile on his face and he his hugged by his teammates.

Sandeep Sharma to Dhoni, 1 run, brilliant from Sandeep Sharma! Not a memorable finish for Dhoni but he tried his best! A yorker outside off, Dhoni can't get underneath it as he whips it straight to deep mid-wicket. Sandeep Sharma has a beaming smile on his face and he his hugged by his teammates.

The RR players have held their nerves, to win by only 3 runs! Dhoni and Jadeja tried their best but couldn't pull off a fairytale win for CSK! Gaikwad got out early but Conway and Rahane stitched a 50-run stand together, keeping the scoreboard ticking. But, the spinners were getting grip and turn as expected and they kept the run rate in check. It was always going to be a battle against spin on this track and Chahal and Ashwin rose to the occasion. In their combined 8 overs, they only conceded 52 runs and took 4 wickets. CSK kept losing wickets due to the asking rate rising but Jadeja and Dhoni gave the hosts a last ray of hope! 40 was needed off the last 2 overs! Holder was taken away for 19 runs in the penultimate over. 20 was needed off the last over and Dhoni would have backed himself. Sandeep missed his mark and he was hit for two consecutive sixes. But, he delivered yorkers when it was needed and Dhoni couldn't finish it off. Stick around for the presentations..

The RR players have held their nerves, to win by only 3 runs! Dhoni and Jadeja tried their best but couldn't pull off a fairytale win for CSK! Gaikwad got out early but Conway and Rahane stitched a 50-run stand together, keeping the scoreboard ticking. But, the spinners were getting grip and turn as expected and they kept the run rate in check. It was always going to be a battle against spin on this track and Chahal and Ashwin rose to the occasion. In their combined 8 overs, they only conceded 52 runs and took 4 wickets. CSK kept losing wickets due to the asking rate rising but Jadeja and Dhoni gave the hosts a last ray of hope! 40 was needed off the last 2 overs! Holder was taken away for 19 runs in the penultimate over. 20 was needed off the last over and Dhoni would have backed himself. Sandeep missed his mark and he was hit for two consecutive sixes. But, he delivered yorkers when it was needed and Dhoni couldn't finish it off. Stick around for the presentations..

I think in the middle overs we needed a bit more strike rotation, there wasn't much for the spinners but they had experienced spinners and we could not rotate strike. It was not that difficult and the ownership (of the loss) should come from the batters. It was good that we could reach striking distance (of the target) as we were the last pair. It really affects NRR when you get to the last phase of the tournament. You see the field, see the bowler and what the bowler is trying to do, after that just stand still and wait for them to commit the mistake, if they bowl in good areas then good luck to them. I would wait for it and that is something which has worked for me, you need to back your strength and my strength is to hit straight. There was a bit of dew and once the ball went to the outfield it became easier for the batters. Overall I was very happy with the bowlers. I really didn't know it was my 200th (game as CSK skipper) and milestones don't really matter for me, it is about how you're performing and the results.

I think in the middle overs we needed a bit more strike rotation, there wasn't much for the spinners but they had experienced spinners and we could not rotate strike. It was not that difficult and the ownership (of the loss) should come from the batters. It was good that we could reach striking distance (of the target) as we were the last pair. It really affects NRR when you get to the last phase of the tournament. You see the field, see the bowler and what the bowler is trying to do, after that just stand still and wait for them to commit the mistake, if they bowl in good areas then good luck to them. I would wait for it and that is something which has worked for me, you need to back your strength and my strength is to hit straight. There was a bit of dew and once the ball went to the outfield it became easier for the batters. Overall I was very happy with the bowlers. I really didn't know it was my 200th (game as CSK skipper) and milestones don't really matter for me, it is about how you're performing and the results.

I wanted to deliver yorkers in the last over. I was bowling good yorkers in the nets. The leg-side was big, but I missed my mark and bowled a couple of low full-tosses and both went for sixes. Then I changed my angle and it worked. I bowled over the wicket to Jadeja and I wanted to keep it away from his reach.

I wanted to deliver yorkers in the last over. I was bowling good yorkers in the nets. The leg-side was big, but I missed my mark and bowled a couple of low full-tosses and both went for sixes. Then I changed my angle and it worked. I bowled over the wicket to Jadeja and I wanted to keep it away from his reach.
- The last team to beat CSK in Chepauk - other than the Mumbai Indians, who have won each of their last four matches at the venue - was Pune Warriors India in 2013 (by 24 runs).

- RR's first win at Chepauk since 2008, they had lost each of their next six thereafter.

The wicket was gripping, and I focused on varying my pace. I didn't want to give them the pace. This is my second season with Ashwin and we have bowled well in partnership. Zampa has played for Australia and we keep discussing in the nets as to how to bowl. Sandeep backed himself and when Mahi bhai is batting, you need to have self-belief and Sandeep pulled it off and that is why runs were not scored. Close games always boost you up for the upcoming games.

You have to give credit to the boys. The bowlers kept their cool at the end and bowled really well, we also held on to our catches. I don't have good memories at Chepauk, never won here and wanted to win today. The ball was gripping and hence, we brought Zampa in as the impact player. We had a good powerplay with Rutu getting out and the thought was if we can get out of the powerplay without giving away too much then we have the spinners to do the job. Last two overs were tensed, I tried to push it deep but you are never safe with I0$. You have to have respect for that guy and to what he can do. Nothing works against him.

I surprise people I guess. Whenever I walk out to bat, people assume I just took that decision and came out, but that's a role given to me, we lost Sanju and I had to do a job. I am far better at judging my strengths, I take a few balls to get going. Every batting innings, I am padded up from the start. It's not an easy thing but it is good. I came off with good Test form. I feel I am able to get good grip and drop on the ball at the right lengths. If I was not able to do those things in the two years (with Punjab Kings) then I wouldn't be able to do it here. Success or failure, it has to be on my own terms.

So, that's it from us for this game! Dhoni couldn't finish it off in style tonight but he tried his best. RR have gone to the top of the table with this win. We have witnessed close finishes in the last four days of the IPL and it has certainly kept us on the edge of our seats! Do join us tomorrow for another high-octane clash as PBKS have returned home and they will host GT. Till then, goodbye and cheers!
